messages.message:
These are always fun to read!

Based on my own experience, heavy upvotes for some of the points made:
1. Prioritizing team efficiency over external demands (https://cep.dev/posts/every-infrastructure-decision-i-endorse-or-regret-after-4-years-running-infrastructure-at-a-startup/#prioritizing-team-efficiency-over-external-demands)
2. Ubuntu for dev servers (https://cep.dev/posts/every-infrastructure-decision-i-endorse-or-regret-after-4-years-running-infrastructure-at-a-startup/#ubuntu-for-dev-servers)
3. Not using open telemetry early (https://cep.dev/posts/every-infrastructure-decision-i-endorse-or-regret-after-4-years-running-infrastructure-at-a-startup/#not-using-open-telemetryhttpsopentelemetryio-early)
4. Not using more code-ish IaC solutions (Pulumi, CDK, etc) (https://cep.dev/posts/every-infrastructure-decision-i-endorse-or-regret-after-4-years-running-infrastructure-at-a-startup/#not-using-more-code-ish-iac-solutions-pulumihttpswwwpulumicom-cdkhttpsawsamazoncomcdk-etc)
5. Not using a network mesh (istio/linkerd/etc) (https://cep.dev/posts/every-infrastructure-decision-i-endorse-or-regret-after-4-years-running-infrastructure-at-a-startup/#not-using-a-network-mesh-istiohttpsistioiolinkerdhttpslinkerdioetc)
6. Go for services (https://cep.dev/posts/every-infrastructure-decision-i-endorse-or-regret-after-4-years-running-infrastructure-at-a-startup/#gohttpsgodev-for-services)
